content: Singaporean politicianThis biography of a living person **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help by adding reliable sources. Contentious material about living persons that is unsourced or poorly sourced **must be removed immediately** from the article and its talk page, especially if potentially libelous. *Find sources:* "Geh Min" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(November 2010)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* Dr. **Geh Min** ([Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 倪敏; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *Ní Mǐn*) is the former President of [Nature Society](/wiki/Nature_Society_(Singapore)) in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). She was formerly a [Nominated Member of Parliament](/wiki/Nominated_Member_of_Parliament) from January 2005 to April 2006. ## Early life and education Geh studied at [Methodist Girls' School](/wiki/Methodist_Girls%27_School,_Singapore) and [Anglo-Chinese School](/wiki/Anglo-Chinese_School). She is a medicine graduate of the [National University of Singapore](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore). ## Career Geh is a consultant ophthalmologist at [Mount Elizabeth Medical Centre](/wiki/Mount_Elizabeth_Medical_Centre), and also a visiting consultant at the [Singapore National Eye Centre](/wiki/Singapore_National_Eye_Centre) and the [National University Hospital](/wiki/National_University_Hospital). In December 2004, Geh was appointed as a [Nominated Member of Parliament](/wiki/Nominated_Member_of_Parliament). In 2006, Geh was one of the three recipients of the inaugural President's Award for the Environment, along with [Tommy Koh](/wiki/Tommy_Koh) and the Waterways Watch Society (WWS). Geh heads the Environment and Health Functional Committee of the South-West Community Development Council. She is a board member of the Nature Conservancy's Asia Pacific Council; the Water Network of the PUB; and the Singapore Environment Council. ## Personal life Geh is the granddaughter of philanthropist [Lee Kong Chian](/wiki/Lee_Kong_Chian). This Singaporean biographical article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Geh Min
